SVG transforms will come in a different PR

There's a test.

Alternativerly, you can CTRL-M (model editor) and add an svg file (look in /test/data/svg) and extrude a 3D link from a 2d shape.

pullrequest.title: SVG support for arcs, disjoints paths and their triangulation / extrusion

content.raw:
There are a few returns due to errors in this function, but even if you get an error, the mesh is generated. This is the case for file `toExtrude18.svg` on issue #1630: Error `[Err] [MeshManager.cc:623] Unable to extrude mesh. Triangulation failed` gets printed, but mesh->visual->link are still generated.

I think there should be a way to return an error and prevent mesh generation if this function returns before the mesh is completed. Maybe moving line 520 to the end of this function is a start? I tried doing it but then Gazebo crashes, I guess this must be fixed all the way to the model editor?
content.html:
There are a few returns due to errors in this function, but even if you get an error, the mesh is generated. This is the case for file toExtrude18.svg on issue #1630: Error [Err] [MeshManager.cc:623] Unable to extrude mesh. Triangulation failed gets printed, but mesh->visual->link are still generated.

I think there should be a way to return an error and prevent mesh generation if this function returns before the mesh is completed. Maybe moving line 520 to the end of this function is a start? I tried doing it but then Gazebo crashes, I guess this must be fixed all the way to the model editor?

content.raw:
Sounds good, I just thought of mentioning it for completeness.

I can imagine a user saving overlapped lines by mistake and not being able to figure out why the extrusion behaves weirdly, so it would be nice to either extrude it properly or gracefully break. But it's a very particular corner case.
content.html:
Sounds good, I just thought of mentioning it for completeness.

I can imagine a user saving overlapped lines by mistake and not being able to figure out why the extrusion behaves weirdly, so it would be nice to either extrude it properly or gracefully break. But it's a very particular corner case.

pull_request.title: SVG support for arcs, disjoints paths and their triangulation / extrusion

pullrequest.title: SVG support for arcs, disjoints paths and their triangulation / extrusion

content.raw:
This file contains invalid geometry for extrusion. Unfortunately, GTS does not refuse to triangulate it, but returns invalid geometry.
We should decide if the file is a valid input. I don't think it is in scope right now (it contains a closed loop that is not the contour of a surface, aka 1 closed manifold), but like chassis.svg we can decide to add functionality to make it work, or stop before the triangulation: checking for overlaps and intersections.

I created issue #1630 to keep track of this.
content.html:
This file contains invalid geometry for extrusion. Unfortunately, GTS does not refuse to triangulate it, but returns invalid geometry. We should decide if the file is a valid input. I don't think it is in scope right now (it contains a closed loop that is not the contour of a surface, aka 1 closed manifold), but like chassis.svg we can decide to add functionality to make it work, or stop before the triangulation: checking for overlaps and intersections.

I created issue #1630 to keep track of this.

pull_request.title: SVG support for arcs, disjoints paths and their triangulation / extrusion

pullrequest.title: SVG support for arcs, disjoints paths and their triangulation / extrusion

content.raw:
[This](https://drive.google.com/open?id=0B5v1KHJYSkP4RXUtYkRCX1lQZm8&authuser=0) file is extruded as I would expect, i.e. the closed path is extruded and the open paths are ignored. But [this](https://drive.google.com/open?id=0B5v1KHJYSkP4d0xjZjZBc3c4T2M&authuser=0) file results in just a face without depth for the closed path.

The second file has a lot of overlapping lines, which I think it should be ok to ignore, but I'd expect the closed path to be extruded like it is for the first file.
content.html:
This file is extruded as I would expect, i.e. the closed path is extruded and the open paths are ignored. But this file results in just a face without depth for the closed path.

The second file has a lot of overlapping lines, which I think it should be ok to ignore, but I'd expect the closed path to be extruded like it is for the first file.
